text:
<@U0289USNA>, <@U02613K0X> here's a thought for the smart quotes button. I don' think I want to put it above the content container, but think it could be nice stuck to the bottom of the text field. As the system grows, i could see this area growing across the bottom for headlines, bold / italics, etc. 

The quote icon is in fact already included in the font, and I'm hoping we can also increase the text padding below, so that we don't get any weird overlap. I don't quite remember if this is a toggle or just a button, but in either case we can use the orange+white as a way to show hover or toggle. 

What do we think?
A file was shared
That's definitely a good starting point...
not that we need the button on one line text fields like blog/work titles but if we did, not sure how that would get implemented on single line - maybe it appear at the end of the line.
and what do you think of the idea of only showing this button when the textbox is "active" (orange stroke rather than grey)
i like the idea of showing it only when “active”
Is there any other "cleanup" stuff that might make sense in a "validate" thing?
So instead of by-block, there would be a blanket "check for a bunch of stuff" option
I worry that this is a little cumbersome from an ease of use angle
what else is there?
probably nothing
:neutral_face:
Oof
I guess what i'm thinking is that it adds a per-block action to writing a blog post
yeah i see what you mean
<@U0289USNA>, i forgot, is this going to work on the field overall? or only on a selection?
the field overall - not a selection
<@U026PHQ3J>: we(?) decided that we cant do smart quotes as a blanket always validation task because to many people do things like <a href=""> in their blog post and smart quotes will break those.
ahhhhh
That makes so much sense I could die.
we are doing this on a block-by-block basis so people are responsible for their own content.
we could do something like this: <http://cl.ly/image/363i05343n0l>
make it appear when the block is active
it could replace the "hints" for other things, like synopsis, this could replace "one sentence" when active
that works too.
that one feels less intrusive to me
not that the other one was really
naw. this is fine. i was worried about conflicts with "helper" info, but if we're smart about showing when active, then i really like it
I think as long as we move users at this point to a common area for "admin" stuff, it solves my problem nicely
If that list gets longer, we can sink it into a menu
but at least we can train people to look there for this kind of stuff
(yes, I treat galapagos as an external product and not an internal toy)
